page.title: 07Shopping in Halewood.
page.content: There are four shopping areas in Halewood. These are on Leathers Lane, Wood Road, Torrington Drive, and in the "village". The shopping area in the village is rather scattered over three roads and just supply the basic needs of the local residents. The shops in this area are relatively old, having served the village area for many years. The three remaining shopping centres were built in the mid 1960's at the same time as the overspill estate. The largest by far is Ravencourt on Leathers Lane. Once again the shopping areas mainly supply food, hardware and other basic needs, although Ravencourt does have clothes shops and a shop selling electrical goods. For larger items and luxury goods the local residents have to go elsewhere.
